main event: A bright white object, resembling a shooting star but with a wider light band, was observed moving through the atmosphere slower than a shooting star over Hopetown, South Africa on June 25, 1960.
interesting points: The object appeared and disappeared at different points above the horizon, moving in the opposite direction of the observer.
A smoke trail was observed following the object at times, at an altitude of around 5,000 feet.
The object was described as brilliant white, resembling burning magnesium.
The Union Defence Force in South Africa had no knowledge of the object impacting in the area.
The observer was unable to determine the object's impact area, trajectory, or distance from the source.
sighted object: a bright white object, resembling a shooting star but with a wider light band
